miner noun [C]
(FINANCE)
someone who uses special software to try to obtain new cryptocurrency (= digital currency produced by a public network rather than by a government): Miners receive rewards for their work in the form of crypto tokens.
More examplesFewer examplesTo earn new bitcoins, you need to be the first miner to arrive at the right answer, or closest answer, to a numeric problem. Miners who successfully solve the problem but haven't verified the most transactions are not rewarded with bitcoin.
